H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7578.def: = state in which humans are trembling with fear

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H816.def: = state in which humans bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H1168.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H6091.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2796.def: = person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2076.def: = causative action by which humans kill one or more animals, usually for food

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H5695.def: = male young of a {L:cow<SDBH:פָּרָה>}; ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H2919.def: = condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life-enhancing; associated with fertility

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4671.def: = debris and husks crushed and separated from grain and carried away by the wind when threshing and winnowing ≈ associated especially with the transient nature and disappearance of evil people and enemies.

H1637.def: = level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2108.def: = marker indicating that an object or event is not included in a range of objects or events

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H1115.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4830.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H7826.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

H5246.def: = one of the great cat family of about 2 m in length and of a yellowish brown color with black spots arranged in rosettes all over the body and the tail; ◄ Panthera pardus; ► hunts by stalking prey; ≈ symbol of violent danger

H7789.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1677.def: = large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger

H7909.def: = state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

H6298.def: = process by which humans, animals, or deities come upon other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another, either or not expectedly; these encounters may be peaceful or result in aggression depending on the nature or intentions of one or both parties

H7167.def: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

H5458.def: literally: the covering of the heart; hence, probably: = the bony frame formed by the ribs, which covers the heart

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5828.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts)  ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H4866.def: = the mouth of a mother's womb; ≈ associated with the moment of birth

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H1698.def: in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God

H6987.def: = event that causes the end of a large number of people

H5164.def: = state in which deities experience a desire to make other humans feel relief after a time of grief

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H6500.def: = process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H4726.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of life and well-being

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H2717.def: = process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H816.def: = state in which humans bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H2030.def: = state in which someone is pregnant

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
